en.title: Emergency Health Response Coordination System
en.purpose: Implement a comprehensive digital platform to coordinate emergency health responses during disasters, disease outbreaks, and humanitarian crises by enabling real-time communication, resource tracking, and decision support across multiple response organizations.
en.scope:
This use case covers the deployment of an emergency response coordination system that:

- Enables real-time situational awareness and incident reporting
- Coordinates resource allocation and logistics across multiple agencies
- Facilitates communication between emergency responders and health facilities
- Supports population health surveillance during emergencies
- Integrates with early warning systems and weather monitoring
en.actors:
**Emergency Response Organizations:**
- **Emergency Operations Centers** – Coordinate overall emergency response activities
- **Public Health Agencies** – Monitor disease outbreaks and health risks
- **Humanitarian Organizations** – Provide emergency medical assistance
- **Emergency Medical Services** – Deliver pre-hospital care and patient transport

**Government Agencies:**
- **Disaster Management Authorities** – Lead emergency preparedness and response
- **Ministry of Health** – Oversee health sector emergency response
- **Military and Civil Defense** – Provide logistical support and security

**Healthcare Facilities:**
- **Hospitals and Clinics** – Treat patients and report capacity status
- **Mobile Health Teams** – Provide care in affected communities
en.preconditions:
**Infrastructure Requirements:**
- Resilient communication networks with backup power systems
- Mobile and satellite communication capabilities for remote areas
- Interoperable information systems across response organizations
- Geographic information systems for mapping and spatial analysis

**Organizational Prerequisites:**
- Established emergency response protocols and standard operating procedures
- Multi-agency coordination agreements and communication frameworks
- Trained personnel familiar with emergency management systems
- Pre-positioned emergency supplies and medical equipment
en.process_steps:
**Phase 1: System Development and Integration (Months 1-8)**
1. Design emergency response coordination platform architecture
2. Develop incident reporting and situational awareness modules
3. Create resource tracking and logistics management systems
4. Integrate with existing emergency management and health information systems
5. Implement secure communication and data sharing protocols

**Phase 2: Testing and Validation (Months 9-12)**
1. Conduct tabletop exercises and simulation drills
2. Test system performance under emergency conditions
3. Validate data integration and information sharing capabilities
4. Train emergency response personnel on platform usage
5. Refine workflows based on exercise feedback

**Phase 3: Deployment and Operationalization (Months 13-18)**
1. Deploy system across all emergency response organizations
2. Establish 24/7 monitoring and technical support capabilities
3. Conduct regular system maintenance and updates
4. Develop standard operating procedures for emergency activation
en.postconditions:
**Enhanced Emergency Response Capabilities:**
- Improved coordination and communication between response agencies
- Faster identification and response to health emergencies
- Better resource allocation and logistics management during crises
- Enhanced situational awareness for decision-makers

**Health System Resilience:**
- Strengthened capacity for disease outbreak detection and response
- Improved patient flow management during mass casualty events
- Enhanced integration between emergency services and healthcare facilities
- Better protection of vulnerable populations during emergencies
en.data_requirements:
**Incident and Emergency Data:**
- Real-time incident reports and situational updates
- Geographic location and affected population estimates
- Resource availability and deployment status
- Weather and environmental monitoring data

**Health and Medical Data:**
- Patient flow and hospital capacity information
- Disease surveillance and outbreak detection data
- Medical supply inventory and distribution tracking
- Health worker deployment and safety status

standards.name: Common Alerting Protocol
standards.description: For standardized emergency alerting and public warning

standards.name: Emergency Data Exchange Language
standards.description: For emergency information sharing and coordination

en.technology_components:
**Core Emergency Management Platform:**
- **DHIS2** configured for emergency health surveillance
- Real-time incident reporting and tracking system
- Geographic information system for mapping and spatial analysis
- Mobile applications for field reporting and communication

**Communication and Coordination:**
- Secure messaging and voice communication systems
- Video conferencing for remote coordination meetings
- Integration with early warning systems and weather services
- Public information and communication tools
en.challenges:
**Coordination and Interoperability Challenges:**
- Ensuring seamless data sharing between diverse organizations and systems
- Coordinating response activities across multiple jurisdictions and agencies
- Managing conflicting priorities and resource allocation decisions
- Maintaining system functionality during infrastructure disruptions

**Information Management Challenges:**
- Balancing information sharing with security and privacy requirements
- Ensuring data quality and accuracy during rapidly evolving situations
- Managing information overload and decision-making under pressure
- Integrating diverse data sources and formats into coherent situational pictures
en.sustainability_considerations:
**Financial and Organizational Sustainability:**
- Securing long-term funding for system maintenance and upgrades
- Developing cost-sharing agreements between participating organizations
- Creating governance structures for ongoing system management
- Building institutional commitment for sustained participation

**Technical and Operational Sustainability:**
- Maintaining technical capacity for system administration and support
- Conducting regular training and exercises to maintain readiness
- Planning for technology upgrades and system evolution
- Ensuring compliance with evolving security and regulatory requirements

fr.title: Système de Coordination de Réponse Sanitaire d'Urgence
fr.purpose: Mettre en œuvre une plateforme numérique complète pour coordonner les réponses sanitaires d'urgence lors de catastrophes et épidémies.
fr.scope:
Ce cas d'usage couvre le déploiement d'un système de coordination d'urgence qui :

- Permet la sensibilisation situationnelle en temps réel
- Coordonne l'allocation des ressources entre agences
- Facilite la communication entre intervenants
- Soutient la surveillance de santé publique
fr.actors:
**Organisations de Réponse d'Urgence :**
- **Centres d'Opérations d'Urgence** – Coordonnent les activités de réponse
- **Agences de Santé Publique** – Surveillent les épidémies
- **Organisations Humanitaires** – Fournissent assistance médicale
fr.preconditions:
**Exigences d'Infrastructure :**
- Réseaux de communication résilients
- Capacités de communication mobile et satellite
- Systèmes d'information interopérables
fr.process_steps:
**Phase 1 : Développement et Intégration (Mois 1-8)**
1. Concevoir l'architecture de la plateforme
2. Développer modules de rapport d'incident
3. Créer systèmes de suivi des ressources
4. Intégrer avec systèmes existants
fr.postconditions:
**Capacités de Réponse Améliorées :**
- Coordination améliorée entre agences
- Identification plus rapide des urgences sanitaires
- Meilleure allocation des ressources
- Sensibilisation situationnelle renforcée
fr.data_requirements:
**Données d'Incident et d'Urgence :**
- Rapports d'incident en temps réel
- Localisation géographique
- Disponibilité des ressources
- Données de surveillance météorologique
fr.technology_components:
**Plateforme de Gestion d'Urgence :**
- **DHIS2** configuré pour surveillance sanitaire d'urgence
- Système de rapport d'incident en temps réel
- Système d'information géographique
fr.challenges:
**Défis de Coordination :**
- Assurer partage de données entre organisations diverses
- Coordonner activités entre juridictions multiples
- Gérer priorités conflictuelles
fr.sustainability_considerations:
**Durabilité Organisationnelle :**
- Sécuriser financement à long terme
- Développer accords de partage des coûts
- Créer structures de gouvernance

es.title: Sistema de Coordinación de Respuesta Sanitaria de Emergencia
es.purpose: Implementar una plataforma digital integral para coordinar respuestas sanitarias de emergencia durante desastres y epidemias.
es.scope:
Este caso de uso cubre el despliegue de un sistema de coordinación de emergencias que:

- Permite conciencia situacional en tiempo real
- Coordina asignación de recursos entre agencias
- Facilita comunicación entre respondedores
- Apoya vigilancia de salud pública
es.actors:
**Organizaciones de Respuesta de Emergencia:**
- **Centros de Operaciones de Emergencia** – Coordinan actividades de respuesta
- **Agencias de Salud Pública** – Monitorean brotes
- **Organizaciones Humanitarias** – Proporcionan asistencia médica
es.preconditions:
**Requisitos de Infraestructura:**
- Redes de comunicación resilientes
- Capacidades de comunicación móvil y satelital
- Sistemas de información interoperables
es.process_steps:
**Fase 1: Desarrollo e Integración (Meses 1-8)**
1. Diseñar arquitectura de plataforma
2. Desarrollar módulos de reporte de incidentes
3. Crear sistemas de seguimiento de recursos
4. Integrar con sistemas existentes
es.postconditions:
**Capacidades de Respuesta Mejoradas:**
- Coordinación mejorada entre agencias
- Identificación más rápida de emergencias sanitarias
- Mejor asignación de recursos
- Conciencia situacional mejorada
es.data_requirements:
**Datos de Incidente y Emergencia:**
- Reportes de incidentes en tiempo real
- Ubicación geográfica
- Disponibilidad de recursos
- Datos de monitoreo meteorológico
es.technology_components:
**Plataforma de Gestión de Emergencias:**
- **DHIS2** configurado para vigilancia sanitaria de emergencia
- Sistema de reporte de incidentes en tiempo real
- Sistema de información geográfica
es.challenges:
**Desafíos de Coordinación:**
- Asegurar intercambio de datos entre organizaciones diversas
- Coordinar actividades entre múltiples jurisdicciones
- Gestionar prioridades conflictivas
es.sustainability_considerations:
**Sostenibilidad Organizacional:**
- Asegurar financiamiento a largo plazo
- Desarrollar acuerdos de compartición de costos
- Crear estructuras de gobernanza
